newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks fall 2.01 pct on S&P credit watch.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks fall 2.01 pct on S&P credit watch.

text.p: Thai stocks declined 2.01 percent by 0737 GMT on Friday as investors sold following reports that a credit ratings agency had placed the ratings of eight Thai financial institutions on negative creditwatch, brokers said.

"The market sentiment was poor as investors unloaded stocks after Standard & Poors said it had placed the ratings of eight financial institutions on negative creditwatch," said Thanadech Mahapokai of Book Club Finance.
By 0748 GMT the index was at 652.52, down 13.10 points.
Standard & Poor's Corp said on Friday it placed Thailand's eight financial institutions, including the largest bank Bangkok Bank Plc, on negative creditwatch.
It said the rating actions reflect concerns that non-performin gloans and loan losses will rise to levels not consitent with current ratings.
It also placed Thailand's "A" long-term foreign currency rating on creditwatch with negative implications.
